titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry David papers, 1943-2010 RL.11256
titlestmt.author: Megan E. Lewis

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-25 10:25:54 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture

did.abstract: Henry Philip David (1923-2009) was a pioneering researcher in the field of reproductive behavior and public policy. He is notable for his longitudinal studies on the psychological aspects of abortion, as well as his extensive international collaboration and research. He was the founder (1972) and director of the Transnational Family Research Institute in Bethesda, MD. He wrote and edited 17 books and authored or co-authored over 300 articles. He's been honored with numerous awards, including the 1993 American Psychological Association Award for Distinguished Contributions to the International Advancement of Psychology. The Henry David papers span the years 1943-2009 and contain materials documenting his professional life, including monographs, photocopied and reprinted journal articles, gray literature, correspondence, subject files, reports, grant proposals, travel brochures, journals, correspondence, conference papers, media clippings, legal reviews of international abortion rights, assessment measures, and questionnaires. It provides extensive documentation of his international family planning research, his international collaborations, his research on adolescents, the legal standing of abortion, abortion as it relates to mental health, and documentation of his work with the Transnational Family Research Institute.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into series: Countries, Adolescents, Legal, Abortion, Research, Miscellaneous, Psychosocial Research, and Abortion and Mental Health Research. There is also a series consisting of unsorted materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henry Philip David (1923-2009) was a pioneering researcher in the field of reproductive behavior and public policy. He is notable for his longitudinal studies on the psychological aspects of abortion, as well as his extensive international collaboration and research. He was the founder (1972) and director of the Transnational Family Research Institute in Bethesda, MD. He wrote and edited 17 books and authored or co-authored over 300 articles. He's been honored with numerous awards, including the 1993 American Psychological Association Award for Distinguished Contributions to the International Advancement of Psychology.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Henry David papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2016-2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Henry David papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Megan Lewis, July, 2016. Updated June, 2018.
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0161; 2017-0038

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Henry David papers span the years 1943-2010 and contain materials documenting his professional life, including monographs, photocopied and reprinted journal articles, grey literature, correspondence, subject files, reports, grant proposals, travel brochures, journals, correspondence, conference papers, media clippings, legal reviews of international abortion rights, assessment measures, and questionnaires. It provides extensive documentation of his international family planning research, his international collaborations, his research on adolescents, the legal standing of abortion, abortion as it relates to mental health, and documentations of his work with the Transnational Family Research Institute.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by country. David arranged materials for each country into the following files: Abortion, Contraception, Fertility-related, and Miscellaneous. Other subject folders were added as needed for each country.

did.unittitle: Regional, Latin America and the Caribbean

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include monographs, questionnaires, surveys, brochures, booklet, clippings, journals, training manuals for health care providers and educators, correspondence, photocopied journal articles and reprints, research notes and research papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include reprints, photocopies of statues, legal reviews, journals, monographs, photocopied journal articles, many from the International Digest of Health Legislation. The materials focus on legal standing of reproductive rights in countries around the world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, reprints, photocopies of journal articles, newspaper and magazine clippings, grant proposals, reports, case studies, conference papers, monographs, works by Malcolm Potts, Christopher Tietze, and Warren Hern.

did.unittitle: American Institutes for Research (AIR)/Transnational Family Research Institute (TFRI)
TFRI secretary Mary J. Albert's detailed notes on the daily operations of TFRI

Documentation and correspondence concerning the hearing before the House of Representatives on the medical and psychological impact of abortion

Annual Review of Population Law, vol. 10-18
Research papers (published and draft) and news coverage on the social and psychological effects of abortion, as well as post abortion, postnatal, and postpartum mental health

Center for Disease Control: Abortion reports, statistics
Motherhood: Pregnancy, maternal mortality, childbirth, childrearing
Violence against women: domestic, sexual, FGM
Psychosocial Workshop agendas, participant lists, and schedules

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics include: abortion, contraception, women's health, gender roles, family and marriage. Countries: U.S. (bulk), Cuba, Peru. People: Warren Hern, Malcolm Potts, Christopher Tietze.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Abortion, abortion law, contraception, fertility, gender roles, mental health. Contries: China, Thailand, Sweden, Philippines, Tahiti, Sudan, Tanzania, Syria, Iceland, Ireland, South Korea, Jamaica, Lichtenstein, Zambia, United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Abortion, contraception, family planning, women's empowerment, women's health, mental health, female genital mutilation, gender roles, men/male roles, HIV/AIDS/STIs, sex education, sexual abuse/exploitation, postabortion care. Places: Africa, Europe, US, Russia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Family planning, contraception, abortion, population issues. Places: US, Europe, China, Sri Lanka, Trinidad and Tobago, India

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Abortion, family planning, marriage and family, population studies, research methodology, sexuality, sex knowledge/experience, social science/general practice psychology, research methods. Places: Korea, China, East Africa, Costa Rica, Chile, United States. People: James Jaccard, Murray Straus, Harlan Strauss

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Abortion attitudes, abortion seekers, family planning, marriage and family, behavior, population studies, research methodology. Places: United States, Hungary, Ygoslavia, Singapore, Japan, France, Nigeria, Jamaica. People: John R.P. French, Earl Schaeffer, Harrison Gough, Warren Miller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topcs: Abortion law, reproductive law, family planning, demographic transition, population development. Places: Romania, United States, Eastern Europe, Russia, Germany, Africa, Kenya, Cuba

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Abortion, abortion law, quinacrine sterilization, contraception (male and female), contraceptive choice/use, misoprostal, mifepristone. Places: United States (bulk), Saudi Arabia, Russia, Africa, Kenya, Cameroon, Mauritius, Ghana, Latin America, South America, Cuba, Eastern Europe. People: Rebecca Cook, Sally Epstein, Donald Collins, Stephen Mumford

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topic: Abortion, various aspects. Places: United States, Israel, Puerto Rico, Australia. People: Stanley Henshaw
